block.p: Katherine Mary Howlett, a daughter of Kristine and Mark Howlett of San Juan Capistrano, Calif., was married last evening to Jamie Scott Platto, a son of Leslie and Charles Platto of Norwich, Vt. Gary L. Granville, the commissioner of marriages for Orange County, Calif., officiated at the Ritz-Carlton Laguna Niguel Hotel in Dana Point, Calif.

Mrs. Platto, 25, graduated from Stanford University and is a candidate for a master's degree in English literature at Georgetown University. Her father is the vice president for corporate development at the Epicor Software Corporation in Irvine, Calif.

Katherine Mary Howlett, a daughter of Kristine and Mark Howlett of San Juan Capistrano, Calif., was married last evening to Jamie Scott Platto, a son of Leslie and Charles Platto of Norwich, Vt. Gary L. Granville, the commissioner of marriages for Orange County, Calif., officiated at the Ritz-Carlton Laguna Niguel Hotel in Dana Point, Calif.

Mrs. Platto, 25, graduated from Stanford University and is a candidate for a master's degree in English literature at Georgetown University. Her father is the vice president for corporate development at the Epicor Software Corporation in Irvine, Calif.

Mr. Platto, 29, graduated from the University of Chicago. In January, he received an M.B.A. from Boston University, from which he also holds a law degree. His father is a lawyer in Norwich and an adjunct professor of insurance law at the Vermont Law School in South Royalton. The bridegroom's mother is an assistant director for puppy evaluations at Guiding Eyes for the Blind in Patterson, N.Y.
